Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed black with, from top, band of alternate red and white large crescents; triple white line; double outlined alternate white(?) and red petals; exterior reserved with two brown lines.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels for the interior decoration, see British Museum 1924,1201.375.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 98, no. 302.3, pl. XXXII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2015) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 211, no. 12)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5972 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
